snippet: The Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear arguments in a case brought by two activists in Greece, N.Y., who object to the Town Board’s prayer tradition.
abstract: Supreme Court will hear arguments in case brought by Susan Galloway and Linda Stephens, residents of Greece, NY, who object to Town Board’s prayer tradition; woemn say prayers violate First Amendment clause that prohibits  establishment of religion; court’s ruling could be one of the most significant church-state decisions in 30 years, and could affect nature of such invocations in municipal meetings nationwide.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear arguments in a case brought by two activists in Greece, N.Y., who object to the Town Board’s prayer tradition.

headline.main: New York Town Divided as Prayer Case Heads to Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Upstate Community Is Divided as Prayer Case Heads to the Supreme Court
